procedure.title: The Provision of Quantity Surveying Consultancy Service required for 2no. separate Housing Schemes in one lot (Tamney and Creeslough)
procedure.description:
**Title:** The Provision of Quantity Surveying Consultancy Service required for 2no. separate Housing Schemes in one lot (Tamney and Creeslough)

**Description:**
The Office of Government Procurement, on behalf of the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage, invites tenders for the provision of Quantity Surveying Consultancy Services for two distinct housing schemes located in Tamney and Creeslough, County Donegal. The services required include:

1. **Site No. 1: HCL 1322**
   - **Project Overview:** The construction of 10 no. Social Housing units and all associated site development works at Mulroy View (Phase 2), Tamney, Co. Donegal.
   - **Scope of Work:**
     - Detailed quantity surveying services for the construction phase.
     - Cost management and budgeting.
     - Site monitoring and reporting.
     - Coordination with architects, engineers, and contractors.
     - Ensuring compliance with relevant building regulations and standards.

2. **Site No. 2: HCG 0422**
   - **Project Overview:** The demolition of 1no. existing single storey dwelling and domestic garage, followed by the construction of 3no. 2-bedroom single storey dwellings including all related site works at Masiness, Creeslough Co. Donegal.
   - **Scope of Work:**
     - Detailed quantity surveying services for the demolition and construction phases.
     - Cost management and budgeting.
     - Site monitoring and reporting.
     - Coordination with architects, engineers, and contractors.
     - Ensuring compliance with relevant building regulations and standards.

**Key Requirements:**
- The successful bidder must have extensive experience in quantity surveying services, particularly in social housing projects.
- The bidder should demonstrate a strong understanding of Irish building regulations and standards.
- The bidder must provide a comprehensive project plan, including timelines and milestones.
- The bidder should have a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
- Technical competence and experience in quantity surveying services.
- Financial stability and ability to manage project costs effectively.
- Quality of the proposed project plan and methodology.
- Past performance and references from previous clients.

**Submission Requirements:**
- A detailed proposal outlining the bidder's approach, methodology, and team composition.
- A comprehensive project plan, including timelines and milestones.
- Financial proposal detailing the costs associated with the services.
- Proof of relevant certifications and qualifications.
- References from previous clients.

**Timeline:**
- The tender process will commence on [insert date] and close on [insert date].
- The successful bidder will be required to commence work on [insert date].

By submitting a proposal, the bidder acknowledges that they have read and understood the terms and conditions of this tender notice. The Office of Government Procurement reserves the right to reject any proposal that does not meet the specified requirements or to cancel the tender process at any stage.

lots.title: The Provision of Quantity Surveying Consultancy Service required for 2no. separate Housing Schemes in one lot (Tamney and Creeslough)
lots.description:
**Title:** The Provision of Quantity Surveying Consultancy Service required for 2no. separate Housing Schemes in one lot (Tamney and Creeslough)

**Description:**
The buyer is seeking a Quantity Surveying Consultancy Service for two distinct housing schemes located in Tamney and Creeslough, County Donegal. The scope of work includes the following:

**Site No. 1:**
- **Location:** Mulroy View, Tamney, Co. Donegal
- **Project:** Construction of 10 no. Social Housing units
- **Scope:** All associated site development works
- **Phase:** Phase 2

**Site No. 2:**
- **Location:** Masiness, Creeslough, Co. Donegal
- **Project:** Demolition of 1no. existing single storey dwelling and domestic garage
- **Scope:** Construction of 3no. 2-bedroom single storey dwellings
- **Scope:** All related site works

The successful bidder will be responsible for providing comprehensive quantity surveying services, including but not limited to:
- Pre-contract services such as feasibility studies, cost estimates, and tender documentation.
- Post-contract services including progress monitoring, variation analysis, and final account settlement.
- Ensuring compliance with relevant building regulations and standards.
- Coordinating with contractors, architects, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth project execution.
- Providing detailed reports and recommendations to the client throughout the project lifecycle.

The bidder should have extensive experience in quantity surveying, particularly in social housing projects. They should demonstrate a strong understanding of Irish building regulations and standards. The ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and maintain high levels of accuracy in financial reporting is essential. The bidder should also have a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget.

The proposal should include detailed information about the bidder's experience, methodology, team composition, and any relevant certifications or qualifications. The bidder should also provide a comprehensive project timeline, highlighting key milestones and deliverables. A detailed breakdown of the costs associated with the services, including any contingencies or potential risks, should also be included. The proposal should be submitted in accordance with the guidelines provided on the eTenders platform.
